commit_message:
_is_physical_chassis returns False if object not in db_store2

If _is_physical_chassis is called with a proxy to a non-existent
chassis, i.e. one that does not exist in db_store2, return False.

We cannot connect to a remote port on a chassis which does not exit.
When the chassis will be added, the relevant ports will be added.

This change also adds the helper function is_model_proxy, to test if an
instance is a model proxy, but without accessing the private _ModelProxy
base class.

Change-Id: I8b81ba8350371c5539e75a73dd9b6911f8f47c52

commit_message:
Add httpchk for http services

The httpchk health check option should help reduce the situtations
where haproxy thinks the service is up but the service is only
listening and not actively serving http requests.

Change-Id: I13cc5dcf2eea53731e756d078586ab9a97340912
Closes-Bug: #1629052

commit_message:
Handle PortNotFound when deleting a network

Tempest has some tests which fail during network cleanup
because they are racing with the subnet delete which cleans
up the neutron:dhcp owned port, which the network delete code
also tries to delete.

This change handles the PortNotFound for these types of auto-deleted
ports so we don't fail to delete the network when the ports are
already gone.

Change-Id: I54ebf2be14e82f288a9bf177967f1136b72b289e
Closes-Bug: #1691176

commit_message:
Add params to manage and configure pipeline publisher

Change-Id: Ifaa3bb0400ee22601fd8f3e1f2f16192b5f8766b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/15/463815/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ManageEventPipeline: default: false description: Whether to manage event_pipeline.yaml. type: boolean EventPipelinePublishers: default: ['gnocchi://'] description: > A list of publishers to put in event_pipeline.yaml. When the collector is used, override this with notifier:// publisher. Set ManageEventPipeline to true for override to take effect. type: comma_delimited_list ManagePipeline: default: false description: Whether to manage pipeline.yaml. type: boolean PipelinePublishers: default: ['gnocchi://'] description: > A list of publishers to put in pipeline.yaml. When the collector is used, override this with notifier:// publisher. Set ManagePipeline to true for override to take effect. ceilometer::agent::notification::pipeline_publishers: {get_param: PipelinePublishers}
deleted_lines: EventPipelinePublishers: default: ['notifier://?topic=alarm.all'] description: A list of publishers to put in event_pipeline.yaml.

commit_message:
Eliminate unnecessary event handling code

The following changes are part of a larger cleanup/refactoring
project.
- Eliminate the use of certain event handlers in the node-list
and node-details controllers, and replace with linear promise
chaining. I believe the use of promise chaining is more performant,
and reduces code complexity.
- Provide more descriptive names for several functions
- Add documentation for several functions

Change-Id: Iba184e4aaf79c7f7c99b3012175f1d8a1bfc79f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-ui refs/changes/53/446153/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add support for soft power transitions

- Add support for reboot, soft reboot, and soft power off transitions
- When appropriate node action lists will contain additional items
for soft power transitions
- The order of items in node action lists has been slightly modified,
placing a known to exist singleton "Edit" at the top of the list.
Power items are now generated as a data-driven enumeration.

Change-Id: If308539e78a7bf707304049534affaa8468fe9f0
Closes-Bug: #1663341
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-ui refs/changes/87/444887/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

  • {$ transition.label $}

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-23 15:11:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-ui/commit/10a205d19092e20b54a09f54eb9f738e0afdf693', 'message': 'Add support for starting/stopping/accessing the serial console

- The action menu in the node-details panel has a new item
Enable|Disable console.
- The node-details/overview panel has a new "Console info." item
in the "General" section. The value of this field is dependent on
the console type. For "shellinabox" the value is an anchor with
the URL of the console and title "shellinabox". For others, the
value is a string representation of the console_info object
returned by the get_console api call.

commit_message:
Add support for starting/stopping/accessing the serial console

- The action menu in the node-details panel has a new item
Enable|Disable console.
- The node-details/overview panel has a new "Console info." item
in the "General" section. The value of this field is dependent on
the console type. For "shellinabox" the value is an anchor with
the URL of the console and title "shellinabox". For others, the
value is a string representation of the console_info object
returned by the get_console api call.

Closes-Bug: #1655690
Change-Id: Ibfa687f50d2251987276367d743ffb2a88e52796

commit_message:
Fix doc generation for Python3

Fix the Sphinx html_last_updated_fmt for Python3.
The html_last_updated_fmt option is interpeted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: Ie6efe365a17bdc73992696e866587a363bdbb900

commit_message:
Make NovaException format errors fatal for tests

Recently, as part of the centralize-config-options work, functionality
that detects errors in NovaException formats was removed [1] because
the config option controlling it was solely being used for testing.

We have had to do a bug fixes like [2] where a testing exception format
error in a mock decorator caused gorpy output to the console during
unit test runs.

To help prevent future bugs, this restores the error detecting
functionality by patching the exception handling to reraise format
error exceptions, only for tests. The _log_exception() function has to
be patched at import time in order to catch exception KeyErrors that
are in mock decorators because those evaluate at test listing time,
before tests actually run.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/397823
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/411502

Change-Id: I680fd46d029ff58bd3b72ef7c7903c2271b26549
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/15/411615/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import sysfrom nova import exceptiondef _patch_nova_exception_to_reraise_format_errors(): real_log_exception = exception.NovaException._log_exception def wrap_log_exception(self): exc_info = sys.exc_info() real_log_exception(self) six.reraise(*exc_info) exception.NovaException._log_exception = wrap_log_exception # NOTE(melwitt) This needs to be done at import time because NovaException # format errors will be raised during test loading, before tests run. _patch_nova_exception_to_reraise_format_errors()

commit_message:
Added in support for new image uploading options

This commit adds support for two new settings related to uploading images. They
are

HORIZON_IMAGES_UPLOAD_MODE
IMAGES_ALLOW_LOCATION

And are documented at

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/topics/settings.html

Change-Id: Ic393f6ba73c40c08d0a7bee4a9a48d35c65e3c0c

"off" disables the # ability to upload images via Horizon. legacy enables local file upload by # piping the image file through the Horizon’s web-server. direct sends the # image file directly from the web browser to Glance. # # [*images_allow_location*] # (optional)Set the IMAGES_ALLOW_LOCATION option. # If set to True, this setting allows users to specify an image location # (URL) as the image source when creating or updating images. # $images_upload_mode = 'legacy', $images_allow_location = false, validate_re($images_upload_mode, ['^legacy$', '^direct$', '^off$'])

commit_message:
Move conntrack zones to IPTablesFirewall

The regular IPTablesFirewall needs zones to support safely
clearly conntrack entries.

In order to support the single bridge use case, the conntrack
manager had to be refactored slightly to allow zones to be
either unique to ports or unique to networks.

Since all ports in a network share a bridge in the IPTablesDriver
use case, a zone per port cannot be used since there is no way
to distinguish which zone traffic should be checked against when
traffic enters the bridge from outside the system.

A zone per network is adequate for the single bridge per network
solution since it implicitly does not suffer from the double-bridge
cross in a single network that led to per port usage in OVS.[1]

This had to adjust the functional firewall tests to use the correct
bridge name now that it's relevant in the non hybrid IPTables case.

1. Ibe9e49653b2a280ea72cb95c2da64cd94c7739da

Closes-Bug: #1668958
Closes-Bug: #1657260
Change-Id: Ie88237d3fe4807b712a7ec61eb932748c38952cc
(cherry picked from commit c76164c058a0cfeee3eb46b523a9ad012f93dd51)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-28 09:52:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3b5d341cd96f58cb1e71af1248db4c79059b9d9f', 'message': "Stop killing conntrack state without CT Zone

The conntrack clearing code was belligerenty killing connections
without a conntrack zone specifier when it couldn't get the zone
for a given device. This means it would kill all connections based
on an IP address match, which meant hitting innocent bystanders
in other tenant networks with overlapping IP addresses.

using the wrong identifier for a port to look up the zone.

to never clear conntrack entries if we can't find the conntrack
zone for a port.

This triggered the bug below (in the cases I root-caused) by
killing a metadata connection right in the middle of retrieving
a key.

commit_message:
Stop killing conntrack state without CT Zone

The conntrack clearing code was belligerenty killing connections
without a conntrack zone specifier when it couldn't get the zone
for a given device. This means it would kill all connections based
on an IP address match, which meant hitting innocent bystanders
in other tenant networks with overlapping IP addresses.

This bad fallback was being triggered every time because it was
using the wrong identifier for a port to look up the zone.

This patch fixes the port lookup and adjusts the fallback behavior
to never clear conntrack entries if we can't find the conntrack
zone for a port.

This triggered the bug below (in the cases I root-caused) by
killing a metadata connection right in the middle of retrieving
a key.

Closes-Bug: #1668958
Change-Id: Ia4ee9b3305e89c958ac927980d80119c53ea519b
(cherry picked from commit ff3132d8d455012b2b29f1eb65817f8492f84fe9)
(cherry picked from commit 5a0700ee9f1c2fc7d651003b4ede8d850199c28b)

Zone map: %(zm)s", {'dev': device_info['device'], 'zm': self._device_zone_map}) continue ip_cmd = [str(net.ip), '-w', zone_id] @staticmethod def _port_key(port_id): return port_id[:(n_const.LINUX_DEV_LEN - n_const.LINUX_DEV_PREFIX_LEN)] def get_device_zone(self, port_id): short_port_id = self._port_key(port_id) self._port_key(port['device'])

subject: Clear conntrack entries without zones if CT zones are not used
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-28 09:52:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c36d6a19667704a982ab3627be3320a09d757ffe', 'message': 'Clear conntrack entries without zones if CT zones are not used

CT zones are used only in OVSHybridIptablesFirewallDriver.
Such zones are not set in IptablesFirewallDriver class but
even if iptables driver was is not using CT zones, it was
used by conntrack manager class during delete of conntrack
entry.
This cause issue that for Linuxbridge agent established and
active connection stayed active even after security group
rule was deleted.
This patch changes conntrack manager class that it will not
use CT zone (-w option) if zone for port was not assigned
earlier.

Closes-bug: 1657260

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/fullstack/test_securitygroup.py

Change-Id: Ib9c8d0a09d0858ff6f36db406c6b2a9191f304d1
(cherry-picked from 10bfa690885f06316ccec1fee39e51ca64058443)
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-28 12:05:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9a7fe1cc115faf396428a58afb16d9125b893f6f', 'message': 'Clear conntrack entries without zones if CT zones are not used

commit_message:
Clear conntrack entries without zones if CT zones are not used

CT zones are used only in OVSHybridIptablesFirewallDriver.
Such zones are not set in IptablesFirewallDriver class but
even if iptables driver was is not using CT zones, it was
used by conntrack manager class during delete of conntrack
entry.
This cause issue that for Linuxbridge agent established and
active connection stayed active even after security group
rule was deleted.
This patch changes conntrack manager class that it will not
use CT zone (-w option) if zone for port was not assigned
earlier.

Closes-bug: 1657260

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/fullstack/test_securitygroup.py

Change-Id: Ib9c8d0a09d0858ff6f36db406c6b2a9191f304d1
(cherry-picked from 10bfa690885f06316ccec1fee39e51ca64058443)

commit_message:
Add ADFSPassword to keystoneauth1 entry points

The ADFSPassword plugin is not registered as an entry point under
keystoneauth1.plugin, and is therefore unusable from the “openstack” CLI
as a valid authentication plugin.

This commit registers the ADFS plugin in entry points as v3adfspassword.

Change-Id: Ic95c25647d91ea2de51a3eea7672a45c48bdaefb
Closes-Bug: #1687314

commit_message:
Don't prompt to uninstall things

If we are uninstalling a package, don't stop and wait for the user,
devstack is expected to run non-interactively.

Change-Id: Ifad155fb456561bb41e639a3742a101b4e59d4b2

commit_message:
Add --skip-deploy-identifier

Add a new cli argument, --skip-deploy-identifier. The argument will
eventually be passed to the tripleo-common DeployStackAction action to
disable setting a unique value for the DeployIdentifier parameter, which
means the SoftwareDeployment resources in the templates will only be
triggered if there is an actual change to their configuration. This
argument can be used to avoid always applying configuration, such as
during node scale out.

Removes the setting of DeployIdentifier completely from tripleoclient,
as that is now handled by the tripleo-common action.

Depends-On: Idb901a841846fec33d189b3c95f669b0380498ce
Change-Id: I294eabe84e070367981534030b5927062f00c628
Closes-Bug: #1688387
(cherry picked from commit f3acb69ffce3c630df5b3051779a7af21b96af47)

commit_message:
Parameterize OVB stack flavors

Running quickstart with OVB  needs to work with multiple host
clouds where different flavor sets are available.

This review:
* Adds variables to the flavor specifications so that they can be
  overwritten by config files per host cloud environment
* Adds functionality to clean up stacks and keypairs
  from the host cloud environment
* Includes cloning the Openstack Virtual Baremetal repo
  within the ovb-manage-stack role
* Deletes the clouds.yaml file so it is not available,
  with the tenant password exposed for longer than
  necessary to create or delete the stack
* Changes the default key location to use
  the user's default key on the undercloud

Change-Id: I5f0f7327a2509ef889b80a35024478b13df2c2a9

commit_message:
Kuryr Kubernetes Port Manager design reference document

Change-Id: Id65c9c1a379eac219ae2559a7b1f1ad267278b74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/81/427681/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode Convention for heading levels in Neutron devref: ======= Heading 0 (reserved for the title in a document) ------- Heading 1 ~~~~~~~ Heading 2 +++++++ Heading 3 ''''''' Heading 4 (Avoid deeper levels because they do not render well.) ======================================== Kuryr Kubernetes Resource Manager Design ======================================== Purpose ------- The purpose of this document is to present Kuryr Kubernetes Resource Manager, capturing the design decision currently taken by the kuryr team. The main purpose of the Resource Manager is to offload some of the Neutron resources handling (e.g., ports creation and deletion) from the current pod management pipeline in order to speed up certain actions, such as pods creation or deletion. Overview -------- Interactions between Kuryr and Neutron may take more time than desired from the container management perspective. Some of these interactions between Kuryr and Neutron can be optimized. For instance, by ensuring that Neutron resources are ready when needed instead of asking for their creation during pod lifecycle pipeline. As an example, every time a container is created or deleted, there is a call from Kuryr to Neutron to create/remove the port used by the container. To optimize this interaction and speed up both container creation and deletion, the Kuryr Kubernetes Resource Manager will take care of both: Neutron ports creation beforehand, and Neutron ports deletion afterwards. This will consequently remove the waiting time for: - Creating ports and waiting for them to become active when booting containers - Deleting ports when removing containers Proposed Solution ----------------- The Resource Manager is in charge of handling different Neutron resources, such as ports or subnets. The main different with the current implementation resides on when and how these resources will be managed. The idea behind is to handle the Neutron resources creation and deletion outside of the container lifecycle pipeline, performing the actions asynchronously either before or after, with the consequent speed up due to fewer Kuryr-Neutron calls. The initial implementation will focus on Neutron ports management, but similar optimization can be done for other Neutron resources, and consequently new resource managers will be added. Ports Manager ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The Port Resource Manager will handle different pool of ports: - Disposable pools: There will be a pool for each tenant and for each security group, ready to be used by the pods. - Cleanable pool: Instead of deleting the port during pods removal, the port will just be included into this pool. The ports in this pool will be later deleted by the Port Resource Manager. The Port Resource Manager will handle the disposable pools, ensuring that at least X ports are ready to be used at each pool, i.e., for each security group and tenant. The port creation at each disposable pool will be handled in batches, i.e., instead of creating one port at a time, a few of them will be created altogether. The Port Resource Manager will check, for each pod creation, that the remaining amount of ports in the specific pool is above X. Otherwise it creates Y extra ports for that pool (with the specific tenant and security group). Thanks to have the disposable ports pool, during the container creation process, instead of calling Neutron port_create and then waiting for the port to become active, a port will be taken from the right disposable pool (hence, no need to call Neutron), and then the port info will be updated with the proper container name (i.e., call to Neutron port_update). Note there is no need to wait for the port to becoming active. Thus, thanks to the Port Manager, at least two calls to Neutron are skiped, while doing an extra one (update) which is faster than the other ones. Similarly, for the port deletion we save the call to remove the port as it is just included in the cleanable pool. Kuryr Controller Impact +++++++++++++++++++++++ A new Kubernetes Event Handlers will be added to the Controller pipeline for each type of Neutron resource being handled. For the pool of ports, the next handler is added: - PortsPoolsHandler manages ports creation/deletion actions upon pods creation/deletion events. It will ensure that at least X ports are available for each tenant and security group. Similarly, it will ensure that ports are cleaned up after pods deletion.

commit_message:
Add RBAC tests for v3 auth policy actions

Implements RBAC tests for v3 auth-related policy actions contained
in [0]. But since the Tempest identity v3 client currently only
has an endpoint for list_auth_projects [1], this patch only adds an
RBAC test for identity:get_auth_projects.

Once the other endpoints (show_auth_catalog and list_auth_domains)
are added to the Tempest client, then the remaining tests can be
added in a follow-up patch.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/common/policies/auth.py
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/lib/services/identity/v3/identity_client.py

Change-Id: I002acfe760aeaab6d4618d366a2da522c6a27695
Partial-Bug: #1687317

commit_message:
Add OVB support to devmode.sh

The change allows the devmode.sh to call into full-deploy-ovb.
* Adds dlrn-gate and dlrn-gate-check quickstart.sh run
  that uses the build-test-packages role and
  install-built-repo role
* Allows the user to clean up the host cloud environment
  before deploying a new heat stack
* Allows the user pass settings files to devmode to deploy
  on different host clouds

Change-Id: I26e65f3c61c2c5595c901d7a3f9bdd381cd08932
Co-authored-by: Ronelle Landy <rlandy@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: John Trowbridge <trown@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Wes Hayutin <weshayutin@mgail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/49/452249/51 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Use new argument types if [ "$2" = "none" ]; LEGACY_MODE=0 RELEASE=$1 CONFIG=$3 JOB_TYPE=$4 ENVIRONMENT_FILE=$5 else LEGACY_MODE=1 RELEASE=$1 HW_ENV_DIR=$2 NETWORK_ISOLATION=$3 CONFIG=$4 OVB_SETTINGS_FILE=$5 OVB_CREDS_FILE=$6 PLAYBOOK=$7 JOB_TYPE=$8 fi if [ "$LEGACY_MODE" = "1" ]; then bash quickstart.sh \ --bootstrap \ --working-dir $WORKSPACE/ \ --tags all \ --no-clone \ --config $WORKSPACE/$HW_ENV_DIR/network_configs/$NETWORK_ISOLATION/config_files/$CONFIG \ --extra-vars @$OVB_SETTINGS_FILE \ --extra-vars @$OVB_CREDS_FILE \ --extra-vars @$WORKSPACE/$HW_ENV_DIR/network_configs/$NETWORK_ISOLATION/env_settings.yml \ --playbook $PLAYBOOK \ --release ${CI_ENV:+$CI_ENV/}$RELEASE${REL_TYPE:+-$REL_TYPE} \ $OPT_ADDITIONAL_PARAMETERS \ $VIRTHOST else bash quickstart.sh \ --bootstrap \ --working-dir $WORKSPACE/ \ --tags all \ --no-clone \ --config $WORKSPACE/config/general_config/$CONFIG.yml --extra-vars @$ENVIRONMENT \ --playbook baremetal-full-deploy.yml \ --release $RELEASE \ $VIRTHOST
deleted_lines: RELEASE=$1 HW_ENV_DIR=$2 NETWORK_ISOLATION=$3 CONFIG=$4 OVB_SETTINGS_FILE=$5 OVB_CREDS_FILE=$6 PLAYBOOK=$7 JOB_TYPE=$8 bash quickstart.sh \ --bootstrap \ --working-dir $WORKSPACE/ \ --tags all \ --no-clone \ --config $WORKSPACE/$HW_ENV_DIR/network_configs/$NETWORK_ISOLATION/config_files/$CONFIG \ --extra-vars @$OVB_SETTINGS_FILE \ --extra-vars @$OVB_CREDS_FILE \ --extra-vars @$WORKSPACE/$HW_ENV_DIR/network_configs/$NETWORK_ISOLATION/env_settings.yml \ --playbook $PLAYBOOK \ --release ${CI_ENV:+$CI_ENV/}$RELEASE${REL_TYPE:+-$REL_TYPE} \ $OPT_ADDITIONAL_PARAMETERS \ $VIRTHOST

subject: Fix absolute paths in scenario001-multinode.yaml
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-15 14:31:37.000000000', 'files': ['ci/environments/scenario001-multinode.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/22433c54af1bac63c256971da43a2070d0608900', 'message': "Fix absolute paths in scenario001-multinode.yaml

All paths should be relative as we should not rely on the package
location - this can easily be overridden via --templates, and this
is exactly what we do for the upgrades job, where this will break
because we'll include the wrong (newer) version of these services
when deploying the older pre-upgrade overcloud.

Change-Id: Id8aea09305c0857253c44477945e34377cca64ca
"}]
commit_message:
Fix absolute paths in scenario001-multinode.yaml

All paths should be relative as we should not rely on the package
location - this can easily be overridden via --templates, and this
is exactly what we do for the upgrades job, where this will break
because we'll include the wrong (newer) version of these services
when deploying the older pre-upgrade overcloud.

Change-Id: Id8aea09305c0857253c44477945e34377cca64ca

commit_message:
Disable ComputeNeutron* for cisco-nexus-ucsm

It seems this wasn't adjusted when https://review.openstack.org/#/c/338315/
landed, which added interfaces for compute specific neutron configuration,
which is disabled for most vendor backends.

Change-Id: I4c98008107568b3b65decd7640e25c7d2b1ea9ff
Related-Bug: #1687597
(cherry picked from commit 95fbda4d0254edb12bfec1ccd41d3b5f6204fe8f)

commit_message:
Use journal.record everywhere

There's no need to call the DB layer, this should be abstracted by
journal.record so use that everyewhere instead of directly calling the
function.
This has no impact on tests so no need to change them to use this
function.

commit_message:
Send MAC updates to ODL for SRIOV PFs

When the MAC on a port changes, as is the case for attaching
VM to SRIOV Physical Function(PF), ODL was not being informed.

This change removes the MAC filter on ODL port updates, so
that ODL will be informed if/when MAC changes for a port.

Change-Id: I58eb690eb212a9b98293a2a0d03b4e10ed5210e3
Closes-Bug: 1686799
(cherry picked from commit 9fd3bb17a3490e6acca2f62973876ed529ca0dce)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/36/461136/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Send MAC updates to ODL for SRIOV PFs

When the MAC on a port changes, as is the case for attaching
VM to SRIOV Physical Function(PF), ODL was not being informed.

This change removes the MAC filter on ODL port updates, so
that ODL will be informed if/when MAC changes for a port.

Change-Id: I58eb690eb212a9b98293a2a0d03b4e10ed5210e3
Closes-Bug: 1686799
(cherry picked from commit 9fd3bb17a3490e6acca2f62973876ed529ca0dce)

commit_message:
Fix UT failures with multiple flow classifiers

Only observed on CentOS, but could happen on other systems:
 AssertionError: Mismatched values: 'source_ip_prefix',
 expected: u'10.0.0.9', actual: u'10.0.0.10

The list of flow classifiers can be in a different order than the
creation one, which causes the mismatch.

These tests now sort (on a relevant key) flow classifiers and expected
values lists. The assert check was also rewritten from the deprecated
assertDictContainsSubset method, and works fine on python 2 and 3

Change-Id: I5d7a6b4902522926ec07d06c8a291c5f41adc5bf
Closes-Bug: #1666568
(cherry picked from commit c28f7a38bd18d285392a97bb1730d63ef3f19d36)

commit_message:
[Gate fix] Fix volume metadata RBAC tests

This patch fixes volume metadata RBAC tests in
``test_volume_metadata_rbac`` that are currently
failing in the gate [0].

Because a 404 is being thrown for certain volume
metadata tests for the v3 API version, this
patch removes v3 support for these tests.

This patch also corrects two previously incorrect
policy actions:
  * ``test_create_volume_metadata`` should enforce
     "volume:create_volume_metadata" not
     "volume:update_volume_metadata"
  * ``test_show_volume_metadata`` should enforce
    "volume:get_volume_metadata`` not "volume:get"
    (it also enforces "volume:get" but that is
    not the directly relevant policy action)

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/26/465126/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-admin-ubuntu-xenial/c4d1ba0/console.html

Change-Id: I2f98494e44e341b0a3e8c6aa2502961f8d804280
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/48/465148/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def setUp(self): super(VolumeMetadataRbacTest, self).setUp() self._add_metadata(self.volume) def tearDown(self): self.volumes_client.update_volume_metadata(self.volume['id'], {}) super(VolumeMetadataRbacTest, self).tearDown() def _add_metadata(self, volume): metadata = {"key1": "value1"} self.client.create_volume_metadata(self.volume['id'], metadata)[ 'metadata'] rule="volume:create_volume_metadata") rule="volume:get_volume_metadata") def test_show_volume_metadata(self): updated_metadata_item = {"key1": "value1_update"} self.client.update_volume_metadata_item( self.volume['id'], "key1", updated_metadata_item)['meta'] updated_metadata = {"key1": "value1"} self.client.update_volume_metadata(self.volume['id'], updated_metadata) self.client.update_volume_image_metadata( self.volume['id'], image_id=self.image_id)
deleted_lines: cls.image_id = CONF.compute.image_ref cls._add_metadata(cls.volume) @classmethod def _add_metadata(cls, volume): metadata = {"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2", "key3": "value3", "key4": "<value&special_chars>"} cls.client.create_volume_metadata(cls.volume['id'], metadata)['metadata'] rule="volume:update_volume_metadata") rule="volume:get") def test_get_volume_metadata(self): # Metadata to update update_item = {"key3": "value3_update"} self.client.update_volume_metadata_item(self.volume['id'], "key3", update_item)['meta'] # Metadata to update update = {"key1": "value1", "key3": "value3"} self.client.update_volume_metadata(self.volume['id'], update) self.client.update_volume_image_metadata(self.volume['id'], image_id=self.image_id) class VolumeMetadataV3RbacTest(VolumeMetadataRbacTest): _api_version = 3

commit_message:
Fix ODL URL creation logic.

ODL url is incorrectly created as:
http://192.168.56.1:8181/controller/nb/v2/neutron/l2-gatewaies
instead of
http://192.168.56.1:8181/controller/nb/v2/neutron/l2-gateways

This fix ensures correct url creation.

Change-Id: I9ab7b6273b9e49f6f46a87c65c04e8b1ece10691
Closes-Bug: #1669681
(cherry picked from commit 05b27134b18e2b12bae8f1edbe3140ab3a4513ad)

commit_message:
NetApp: Refresh directory before waiting

After image cloning the NFS client cache needs to be refreshed.
This can be accomplished by touching the directory hosting the
cached image file.

See also: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1617299
Co-Authored-By: Sebastian Schee <sebastian.schee@sap.com>
Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

Closes-bug: #1679716
Change-Id: If392f41f65978721668b53cfab94393f074d24e9
(cherry picked from commit ff6acd62ec778e05276ef6c4514c4bbaef028d7c)
(cherry picked from commit cd3c1c2c37e09130ce56de9234dd548918b7ee9b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/11/464311/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.trace_method def _touch_path_to_refresh(self, path): try: # Touching parent directory forces NFS client to flush its cache. self._execute('touch', path, run_as_root=self._execute_as_root) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError: LOG.exception(_LE("Failed to touch path %s."), path) @utils.trace_method base_path = os.path.dirname(path) self._touch_path_to_refresh(base_path) self._touch_path_to_refresh(base_path)

commit_message:
Change the target for this goal to uWSGI not Apache mod_wsgi

Apache mod_wsgi has substantial downside in use for development, the
devstack project is pushing forward with uWSGI by default (which is
now running in the gate). This is actually *much* easier on projects
to configure, and makes for a more consistent developer experience
when working on projects with both wsgi and worker components.

Change-Id: I81e4e5f37c0e0679df9a275e3377b4652d814740

deleted_lines: #. Switch devstack jobs to deploy control-plane API services in WSGI with Apache. Usage of Apache is already the default in Devstack, let's keep using it for consistency unless there is some efforts to support another web server but this is not the case at this time.

more safely.

It may affect other neutron projects to set NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS
in devstack/settings.

commit_message:
Enable BGP extension in gate_hook.sh instead of devstack/settings

This reverts commit "Enable BGP extension" and enables BGP extension
more safely.

It may affect other neutron projects to set NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS
in devstack/settings.

Change-Id: I0737cb057a93fc17e045a8a2f777bee7ed9b13cf

commit_message:
Remove the proxying section from charter

Since voting now happens asynchronously, it's not necessary to proxy
voting through other TC members.

Change-Id: I77c036fa49468c80ffff687ab4de86d95c031d84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/40/463140/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: Proxying ======== When a TC member is unable to make a meeting, they are encouraged to name a proxy that will represent their opinion and vote on their behalf during the meeting. Only members really present at the meeting (directly or proxied) can vote. A TC member may proxy another member, but nobody should ever represent more than two votes.

commit_message:
Pass all instance UUIDs to scheduler

When the RequestSpec object was created, it was assumed that when the
request was for more than one instance the scheduler would not need to
know the UUIDs for the individual instances, and so it was prematurely
optimized to only pass one instance UUID. If, however, we want the
scheduler to be able to claim resources on the selected host, we will
need to know the instance UUID, which will be the consumer_id of the
allocation.

This patch finds all the places where request specs are created, and
adds the field/key 'instance_uuids', which is a list of all the UUIDs
for all instances in the request. It was felt that adding an additional
field was preferable to changing the meaning of the existing
'instance_uuid' field, even if that means a bunch of duplication. The
next patch in the series adds the logic to the scheduler to use this new
field when selecting hosts.

Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-claims

Change-Id: Id6c55af5635297477f34f283064b64445bf6e287

commit_message:
Update sample configuration file for Pike

The last time we updated the sample configuration file was for the
Ocata release candidate. Let's generate a fresh version so that it
is somewhat relevant.

This change was generated using:

  $ tox -e genconfig; git commit -a

Change-Id: I8c4fbce02946b87534da61a4e3e81fc375615d7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/21/465121/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Enable journald for logging. If running in a systemd environment you may wish # to enable journal support. Doing so will use the journal native protocol # which includes structured metadata in addition to log messages.This option is # ignored if log_config_append is set. (boolean value) #use_journal = false #default_log_levels = amqp=WARN,amqplib=WARN,boto=WARN,qpid=WARN,sqlalchemy=WARN,suds=INFO,oslo.messaging=INFO,oslo_messaging=INFO,iso8601=WARN,requests.packages.urllib3.connectionpool=WARN,urllib3.connectionpool=WARN,websocket=WARN,requests.packages.urllib3.util.retry=WARN,urllib3.util.retry=WARN,keystonemiddleware=WARN,routes.middleware=WARN,stevedore=WARN,taskflow=WARN,keystoneauth=WARN,oslo.cache=INFO,dogpile.core.dogpile=INFO# Size of executor thread pool when executor is threading or eventlet. (integer # value)# listen on. (unknown value)# listen on. (unknown value)# Attempt to connect via SSL. If no other ssl-related parameters are given, it # will use the system's CA-bundle to verify the server's certificate. (boolean # value) #ssl = false # SASL realm to use if no realm present in username (string value) #sasl_default_realm = # DEPRECATED: User name for message broker authentication (string value) # This option is deprecated for removal. # Its value may be silently ignored in the future. # Reason: Should use configuration option transport_url to provide the # username.# DEPRECATED: Password for message broker authentication (string value) # This option is deprecated for removal. # Its value may be silently ignored in the future. # Reason: Should use configuration option transport_url to provide the # password.# Default timeout(s) for Kafka consumers (floating point value)# The maximum number of attempts to re-send a notification message which failed # to be delivered due to a recoverable error. 0 - No retry, -1 - indefinite # (integer value) #retry = -1 # Enable SSL (boolean value) #ssl = <None> # Deprecated group/name - [oslo_messaging_rabbit]/kombu_ssl_version #ssl_version =# Deprecated group/name - [oslo_messaging_rabbit]/kombu_ssl_keyfile #ssl_key_file =# Deprecated group/name - [oslo_messaging_rabbit]/kombu_ssl_certfile #ssl_cert_file =# Deprecated group/name - [oslo_messaging_rabbit]/kombu_ssl_ca_certs #ssl_ca_file =# DEPRECATED: Absolute path to the public certificate file to use for signing # responses to revocation lists requests. Set this together with `[signing] # keyfile`. For non-production environments, you may be interested in using # `keystone-manage pki_setup` to generate self-signed certificates. (string # value) # This option is deprecated for removal since P. # Its value may be silently ignored in the future. # Reason: `keystone-manage pki_setup` was deprecated in Mitaka and removed in # Pike. These options remain for backwards compatibility.# DEPRECATED: Absolute path to the private key file to use for signing # responses to revocation lists requests. Set this together with `[signing] # certfile`. (string value) # This option is deprecated for removal since P. # Its value may be silently ignored in the future. # Reason: `keystone-manage pki_setup` was deprecated in Mitaka and removed in # Pike. commit_message:
add release management team logo to team page

Add a logo field to the metadata for the team in the project.yaml file.

If the logo is set, add an image to the team page.

Add the image file for the release management team logo, using the
mascot without any text.

Update the stylesheet in the theme to shift the image to the right of
the text that follows it.

Change-Id: Ia8c7f023d337fe807b30e95f2c7d7f438ce95f11
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/58/433958/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow setting EndpointReference in ADFSPassword

The ADFSPassword plugin currently sets the WS-Policy 'AppliesTo'
EndpointReference Address in the WS-Trust RequestSecurityToken message
to the value specified in the ‘service-provider-endpoint’ option. This
may not be desirable if the Service Provider's SAML entity ID differs
from the WS-Federation Passive Endpoint (i.e. service provider endpoint)
consuming the WS-Trust RequestSecurityTokenResponse.

This commit introduces the ability to specify the EndpointReference used
in the RequestSecurityToken message via the 'service-provider-entity-id'
option. If omitted, the EndpointReference defaults to the value provided
in the ‘service-provider-endpoint' option to preserve backward
compatibility.

Change-Id: I842427232db79d628dc29f5a1dcf68e011667dfa
Closes-Bug: #1689424
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/32/463432/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix the default parameter value in spec test

The default parameter value is 'SERVICE DEFAULT', not 'SERVICE_DEFAULT'.

Closes-Bug: #1690973

Fix the default parameter value in spec test

The default parameter value is 'SERVICE DEFAULT', not 'SERVICE_DEFAULT'.

commit_message:
Mark ZFSSA drivers as unsupported

The ZFSSA CI has not reported success past our CI required
period.

Checking name: Oracle ZFSSA CI
  first seen: 2017-03-24 01:17:07 (41 days, 15:53:25 old)
  last seen: 2017-05-04 16:46:58 (0:23:34 old)
  last success:  None
  Job oracle-zfssa-dsvm-iscsi 0% success out of 250 comments S=0, F=250
Overall success rate: 0% of 250 comments

Per Cinder's non-compliance policy, this patch marks the drivers
as unsupported and deprecated and they will be removed in the
next cycle if the issue is not corrected.

Change-Id: I35ed02d095dbc64d0a1689506a82f3fa8f1ccbe5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/24/463024/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(smcginnis) Remove driver in Queens if CI issues are not resolved SUPPORTED = False

commit_message:
Remove unit tests that test oslo_concurrency.processutils.execute

Remove the unit tests that were testing the functionality of
oslo_concurrency.processutils.execute. It is not our job to unit test
3rd party libraries.

Change-Id: I1516af623346a590e25f4f09226c784031ca78a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-lib refs/changes/67/464067/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Exp. job to test k8s deployment for tripleo

This job installs an undercloud, creates the nodes for the overcloud and
installs a COE on those nodes. This is the base job for future work that
will install OpenStack services on the COE installed here.

Change-Id: I02dff6cc83f2c67e6d08f60bc12dcd5117db764f

commit_message:
Modernize the nova client in cinder

The nova client (used by the InstanceLocalityFilter for example)
seems to have obscure config options (compared to other projects),
and seems it is buggy too. Fix this by introducing a [nova] section,
where the usual auth parameters can be put (auth_type, auth_url,
username, password, etc...), and deprecate the old options.
Also doesn't play with the Service Catalog, the authentication plugins
can handle it, use a Token authentication plugin when using
the user context, and removed the separate usage of the admin endpoint.

Change-Id: I55613793c8f525a36ac74636f47d7ab76f5c7e39
Closes-bug: #1686616
DocImpact: to use a Nova connection (e.g. for InstanceLocalityFilter),
one has to configure the [nova] section.

commit_message:
Optimize kernel neighbour table for large scale environments

Changing the default values of neighbor table (also known as ARP table)
in the kernel to avoid neighbour table overflow and thus fix
communication errors between overcloud nodes.
default kernel values support L2 network up to 1024 hosts (/22).
The patch will allow up to 4096 hosts (/20).

Change-Id: I5fabc766dd75a38cd3d835deee7e168f04dd30ce
Closes-Bug: #1690087

commit_message:
Skip ClamAV db update in gate

This patch disables the ClamAV database update in the gate jobs. The
update often fails due to upstream server issues.

Manually backported since Ocata still uses the pre-release STIG
numbering. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/458949/

Change-Id: I39cfcc102bc98895823b4de9df930e6f273aaf15

commit_message:
Cleanup tox.ini

This patch removes the `func_rhel7` environment and brings over the
verbose options from the tests role.

A manual backport was required due to the STIG renumbering which
happened in Pike but not in Ocata.

Manual-backport-of: I44c2e089ff6175b3004ef7f6713622ac615bf6db
Change-Id: Ib22b3ee159ca3bdb41645bfd069ba7047f9a443b

commit_message:
Fix puppet-module-build

Change I082ea72743634b8ce0106786ab4ec35add874c8d updated the
job-template to use a list of nodes - and that broke the
gate-{name}-puppet-module-build template, since it used node as
variable. Looking at the job defintition of
gate-puppet-nova-puppet-module-build, it has:
<assignedNode>['centos-7', 'ubuntu-xenial']</assignedNode>

Explictely set the node parameter to the previous value of
centos-7.

Change-Id: I4c0e57c67273d0be0edf3bbd9d663a03144db5ae

commit_message:
Do not install NTP when installed in a container

Use determine_packages() to avoid installing NTP when in a container.
Sync charms.ceph to get ceph.determine_packages().

Change-Id: I7a9e8a95b066fc330c1443b87b88f8b7f6b0baee
Partial-Bug: #169051

"""Extra tests for jinja2 templates in Ansible.""" # NOTE(mhayden): Remove this file when jinja 2.9.5 is available for use within # OpenStack. def greaterthan(value, reference_value): """Return true if value > reference_value.""" return value > reference_value def lessthan(value, reference_value): """Return true if value < reference_value.""" return value < reference_value class TestModule: """Main test class from Ansible.""" def tests(self): """Add these tests to the list of tests available to Ansible.""" return { 'greaterthan': greaterthan, 'lessthan': lessthan, }

commit_message:
Fix security role gate

This commit removes the verbose options from the gate job and disables
clamav installation in the CI jobs. The clamav package is only available
in the EPEL repository, but the EPEL repo has been removed from
the CentOS images in the OpenStack gate. This will need to be handled
carefully in a later patch.

It also removes an apostrophe from `tasks/main.yml` that breaks syntax
highlighting in vim.

Change-Id: Ifbfc56ed5fe92887cf5beb6b2703fdc3e1c8bb05

commit_message:
Enable using btrfs as a backend

Enable the usage of btrfs backend. Nothing is done except not using
lxd init as it only supports zfs and dir.

Change-Id: Ic6390e457b80a5d38957c182f270fc9f9d52a60f
(cherry picked from commit d76d4cdc8f114c13e946d7914df1f05af8cc0de7)

commit_message:
Use zuul-cloner for tests repo in OpenStack-CI

When executing the tests repo clone in OpenStack-CI,
use zuul-cloner instead of git to enable cross-repo
testing. This ensures that if a dependent patch from
the tests repo is noted using 'Depends-On: <change-id>'
in the commit message, that patch will be included.

Depends-On: Idce7abebf32f24c356a27e099fbca954d917402b
Depends-On: I5da7802d61d2ab6b03908138e3a3ed2db22e3d29
Change-Id: I469bef1a5aad2b1c31972ec8f8ac3d7c0cdf4cc7

commit_message:
Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

Change-Id: I290fd1e5763bc89028bb9207dbd0bba33bacaa06
(cherry picked from commit 4e4600ef930fbea112e45897f68d770173a09c6c)

commit_message:
Perform an atomic policy file change

The policy.json file is currently read continually by the
services and is not only read on service start. We therefore
cannot template directly to the file read by the service
(if the service is already running) because the new policies
may not be valid until the service restarts. This is
particularly important during a major upgrade. We therefore
only put the policy file in place after the service restart.

This patch also tidies up the handlers and some of the install
tasks to simplify them and reduce the tasks/code a little.

Change-Id: I8ece1f91db9177f30623f09036e75794d607e17e
(cherry picked from commit e1f0e4cb0cd541789b605c1dea7c53f32cf47794)

commit_message:
Do not install NTP when installed in a container

Check if the charm is installed inside a container and do not install
NTP if that is the case.

Change-Id: I9a9a50e724e24aa0d5b04d544a82b2d8202cd181
Partial-Bug: #169051

commit_message:
do not log error for missing _save_tags

The instance.save always logs the below error message if instance.tags
are lazy loaded before the save.

AttributeError: 'Instance' object has no attribute '_save_tags'

The tags should never be saved through the instance object so adding an
empty _save_tags function is better than logging an error every time.

Change-Id: Id41b06e7a294d803bd580d38ef04cc0ffb32a3bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/65/450265/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('nova.objects.instance.LOG.exception') def test_save_does_not_log_exception_after_tags_loaded(self, mock_log): instance = objects.Instance(self.context, uuid=uuids.instance, user_id=self.context.user_id, project_id=self.context.project_id) instance.create() tag = objects.Tag(self.context, resource_id=instance.uuid, tag='foo') tag.create() # this will lazy load tags so instance.tags will be set self.assertEqual(1, len(instance.tags)) # instance.save will try to find a way to save tags but is should not # spam the log with errors instance.display_name = 'foobar' instance.save() self.assertFalse(mock_log.called)

commit_message:
Add skip_deploy_identifier

Add a new action argument, skip_deploy_identifier to DeployStackAction.
The argument will disable setting a unique value for the
DeployIdentifier parameter, which means the SoftwareDeployment resources
in the templates will only be triggered if there is an actual change to
their configuration.  This argument can be used to avoid always applying
configuration, such as during node scale out.

Change-Id: Idb901a841846fec33d189b3c95f669b0380498ce
Closes-Bug: #1688387
(cherry picked from commit 9d158874301eaa9444811f2c21cc9d86c2eaad7a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/23/462723/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Add a new action argument, skip_deploy_identifier to DeployStackAction. The argument will disable setting a unique value for the DeployIdentifier parameter, which means the SoftwareDeployment resources in the templates will only be triggered if there is an actual change to their configuration. This argument can be used to avoid always applying configuration, such as during node scale out. This option should be used with Caution, and only if there is confidence that the software configuration does not need to be run, such as when scaling out certain roles.

commit_message:
Magnum: Move keypair handling at the cluster level

Also fix a small bug to allow the use of an existing template
in create_and_list_clusters scenario.

Change-Id: I7dd84bcd54abcfe5c0af5eb6825c0fb0a52ff4cf

commit_message:
Eliminate mixin references in DVRResourceOperationHandler

This eliminates the mixin references in DVRResourceOperationHandler
to prepare for it to be used by the DVR service provider and to be
removed from the main L3 plugin mixin.

Related: blueprint multi-l3-backends
Change-Id: I5ab6b92b67e6d3b461fd118ef0a26d6f6b6992c4

commit_message:
Container Creation health plugin

This plugin creates and deletes a container on each node in the
cluster to test the container manager. It uses a Job created by
a DaemonSet to ensure that a container is created on each node.

Change-Id: Ic2821ecc9788b85cb359a6ac29861d8eb1124dc9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/61/462761/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (C) Copyright 2017 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development LP import json import random import requests import string import time from monasca_agent.collector import checks from monasca_agent.collector.checks import utils from monasca_agent.common import exceptions DEFAULT_TIMEOUT = 5 DEFAULT_NAMESPACE = 'monitoring' DEFAULT_WAIT_TIME = 5 DAEMONSET_CREATE_BODY = { 'apiVersion': 'extensions/v1beta1', 'kind': 'DaemonSet', 'metadata': { 'name': 'cctest', 'labels': { 'app': 'cctest' } }, 'spec': { 'replicas': 2, 'template': { 'metadata': { 'labels': {} }, 'spec': { 'containers': [ { 'name': 'cctest1', 'image': 'alpine:3.5', 'command': ["sleep", "10m"] } ], 'terminationGracePeriodSeconds': 0, } } } } class KubernetesContainerCreate(checks.AgentCheck): """Creates a Kubernetes DaemonSet then queries the API. If DaemonSet creation and deletion succeeds then the container manager is working correctly. """ def __init__(self, name, init_config, agent_config, instances=None): checks.AgentCheck.__init__(self, name, init_config, agent_config, instances) if instances is not None and len(instances) > 1: raise Exception('Kubernetes api check only supports one configured instance.') self.connection_timeout = int(init_config.get('connection_timeout', DEFAULT_TIMEOUT)) self.namespace = init_config.get('namespace', DEFAULT_NAMESPACE) self.wait_time = int(init_config.get('wait_time', DEFAULT_WAIT_TIME)) self.label = None self.kubernetes_connector = None self.kubernetes_api = None def prepare_run(self): """Set up Kubernetes connection information""" instance = self.instances[0] host = instance.get("host", None) derive_api_url = instance.get("derive_api_url", None) if not host: if derive_api_url: self.kubernetes_connector = utils.KubernetesConnector(self.connection_timeout) else: exception_message = "Either Kubernetes API url (host and port)" \ " or derive_api_url=True must be set" \ " when running Kubernetes API plugin." self.log.error(exception_message) raise Exception(exception_message) else: kubernetes_api_port = instance.get("kubernetes_api_port", "8080") self.kubernetes_api = "http://{}:{}".format(host, kubernetes_api_port) def check(self, instance): random_sufix = ''.join(random.choice(string.ascii_lowercase + string.digits) for x in range(5)) self.label = 'cctest-' + random_sufix DAEMONSET_CREATE_BODY['spec']['template']['metadata']['labels']['app'] = self.label dimensions = self._set_dimensions(None, instance) # Remove hostname from dimensions as the following the metrics are not tied to the hostname. del dimensions['hostname'] result = self._create_daemonset() create_daemonset_success = self._check_create_daemonset_pods_success(result) self.gauge("kubernetes.container_runtime.create_health_status", 0 if create_daemonset_success else 1, dimensions, hostname="SUPPRESS") if not result: self.log.debug("Could not create any pods. Stopping check") return pods = self._report_daemonset_create(dimensions) delete_daemonset_success = self._delete_daemonset() if delete_daemonset_success: self._report_daemonset_delete(dimensions, pods) delete_success_metric = 0 else: self.log.debug("Could not delete DaemonSet") delete_success_metric = 1 self.gauge("kubernetes.container_runtime.delete_health_status", delete_success_metric, dimensions, hostname="SUPPRESS") def _create_daemonset(self): daemonset_create_body = json.dumps(DAEMONSET_CREATE_BODY) endpoint = 'apis/extensions/v1beta1/namespaces/' + self.namespace + '/daemonsets' try: return self._create_resource(endpoint, daemonset_create_body) except exceptions.KubernetesAPIResourceExists as e: # If an old delete failed, try to clean it up try: self._clean_up_daemonset(endpoint) return self._create_resource(endpoint, daemonset_create_body, retried=True) except Exception as e: self.log.warn("Error creating DaemonSet with Kubernetes - {}".format(e)) return None except Exception as e: self.log.warn("Error creating DaemonSet with Kubernetes - {}".format(e)) return None def _clean_up_daemonset(self, endpoint): self.log.info("Daemonset cleanup started. Delete Daemonset failed in the past," " but attempting to correct and cleanup") if not self.delete_daemonset(): exception_message = "Cleanup of old DaemonSet 'ctest' failed. Cannot create new " \ "Daemonset with the same name because API at {} returned " \ "code 409".format(endpoint) raise exceptions.KubernetesAPIResourceExists(exception_message) def _check_create_daemonset_pods_success(self, result): if not result: return False create_success = self._test_daemonset_create(result) # If the pods didn't start up immediately, wait for a little while and check again if not create_success: time.sleep(self.wait_time) endpoint = 'apis/extensions/v1beta1/namespaces/' + self.namespace + '/daemonsets/cctest' try: result = self._get_resource(endpoint) except Exception as e: self.log.warn("Get pods failed with {}".format(e)) return False create_success = self._test_daemonset_create(result) return create_success def _test_daemonset_create(self, daemonset): if daemonset['status']['desiredNumberScheduled'] == 0: return False return daemonset['status']['desiredNumberScheduled'] == daemonset['status']['numberReady'] def _report_daemonset_create(self, dimensions): endpoint = 'api/v1/namespaces/' + self.namespace + '/pods' daemonset_pods = {} try: pods = self._get_resource(endpoint) except Exception as e: self.log.warn("Get pods failed with {}".format(e)) return daemonset_pods for pod in pods['items']: hostname = '{}'.format(pod['spec']['nodeName']) if (pod['metadata']['labels']['app'] and self.label == pod['metadata']['labels']['app']): daemonset_pods[pod['metadata']['name']] = hostname is_running = True for status in pod['status']['containerStatuses']: for key in status['state']: if 'running' != key: is_running = False break self.gauge("kubernetes.node.container_runtime.create_health_status", 0 if is_running else 1, dimensions, hostname=hostname) return daemonset_pods def _delete_daemonset(self): body = { 'kind': 'DeleteOptions', 'apiVersion': 'v1', 'propagationPolicy': 'Foreground' } endpoint = 'apis/extensions/v1beta1/namespaces/' + self.namespace + '/daemonsets/cctest' try: self._delete_resource(endpoint, data=json.dumps(body)) return True except Exception as e: self.log.warn("Error deleting DaemonSet with Kubernetes - {}".format(e)) return False def _report_daemonset_delete(self, dimensions, pods): existing_pods, pods_to_cleanup = self._get_existing_pods() # If the daemonset delete didn't work imediatly, try waiting if pods_to_cleanup: time.sleep(self.wait_time) existing_pods, pods_to_cleanup = self._get_existing_pods() # If the daemonset delete didn't delete pods, try explicitly deleteing the pod if pods_to_cleanup: self._cleanup_pods(pods_to_cleanup) existing_pods, pods_to_cleanup = self._get_existing_pods() for pod, hostname in pods.iteritems(): pod_successfully_deleted = pod not in existing_pods self.gauge("kubernetes.node.container_runtime.delete_health_status", 0 if pod_successfully_deleted else 1, dimensions, hostname=hostname) def _get_existing_pods(self): existing_pods = set() pods_to_cleanup = set() try: endpoint = 'api/v1/namespaces/' + self.namespace + '/pods' result = self._get_resource(endpoint) except Exception as e: self.log.warn("Get existing pods failed with {}".format(e)) return existing_pods, pods_to_cleanup for pod in result['items']: pod_name = pod['metadata']['name'] if 'cctest' in pod_name: pods_to_cleanup.add(pod_name) existing_pods.add(pod_name) return existing_pods, pods_to_cleanup def _cleanup_pods(self, pods): self.log.info("Starting pod cleanup. Deleting DaemonSet did not delete pods {}".format(pods)) for pod in pods: try: endpoint = 'api/v1/namespaces/' + self.namespace + '/pods/' + pod self._delete_resource(endpoint) except Exception as e: self.log.info("Pod cleanup failed. Unable to delete pod: {}".format(e)) def _create_resource(self, endpoint, body, retried=None): if self.kubernetes_connector: try: result = self.kubernetes_connector.create_request(endpoint, body) except exceptions.KubernetesAPIResourceExists as e: if not retried: return self.cleanup() else: raise exceptions.KubernetesAPIConnectionError(e) else: url = "{}/{}".format(self.kubernetes_api, endpoint) result = requests.post(url, data=body) self.log.error("create status code {}".format(result.status_code)) if result.status_code == 409 and not retried: exception_message = "Resource already exists. Could not create " \ "new resource. API at {} returned status code 409 " \ "with text {}".format(url, result.text) raise exceptions.KubernetesAPIResourceExists(exception_message) if result.status_code != 201: exception_message = "Error creating resource from Kubernetes API at {} - got {}" \ " with message {}".format(url, result, result.text) raise exceptions.KubernetesAPIConnectionError(exception_message) result = result.json() return result def _delete_resource(self, endpoint, data=None): if self.kubernetes_connector: return self.kubernetes_connector.delete_request(endpoint, data) else: url = "{}/{}".format(self.kubernetes_api, endpoint) result = requests.delete(url, data=data) if result.status_code != 200: exception_message = "Error deleting resource from Kubernetes API at {} - got {}" \ " with message {}".format(url, result.status_code, result.text) raise exceptions.KubernetesAPIConnectionError(exception_message) return result.json() def _get_resource(self, endpoint): if self.kubernetes_connector: return self.kubernetes_connector.get_request(endpoint) else: url = "{}/{}".format(self.kubernetes_api, endpoint) result = requests.post(url) if result.status_code != 200: exception_message = "Error getting resource from Kubernetes API at {} - got {}" \ " with message {}".format(url, result, result.text) raise exceptions.KubernetesAPIConnectionError(exception_message) return result.json()

commit_message:
Fix python-novaclient 8.0.0 related issues

New python-novaclient release has removed support for
network/image/floating_ip apis. This also means
nova-network support would also cease to exist after
this change.

Change-Id: Icbcf279c10720f99a0aed1a3aaaf3945c5442a8a
Closes-Bug: #1690936

commit_message:
Retrieve quota and usage only for quota-enabled resources

Previously _get_tenant_(compute|network|volume)_usage are callled
regardless of resources are listed in enabled_quotas.
This commit retrives usage information only for resources listed
in eanbled_quotas.

floating_ips and security_groups were returned even when
they are included in disabled_quotas. They are not needed
and they are cleanup in this commit.

All (*_)QUOTA_FILEDS were previously a list but it is always used
after converting into a set, so this commit changes (*_)QUOTA_FIELDS
into a set in the initial definitions.

This is a preparation for fix of bug 1675504

Partial-Bug: #1675504
Change-Id: I41cdabde477d87aa8b35d1c908e18a69454286c3

commit_message:
don't move files on migration

In some cases (shared storage, CSVs), moving the instance
files on cold migration / resize might not be desired.

Adds move_disks_on_cold_migration config option (default value True).

If the config option is True, or if the source instance path is not
on a CSV or a share, the instance files are copied to the destination
node. Otherwise, the files are kept on the source node.

Depends-On: Ic153dcfd621a1e6235dd3a75241274ee7d7c868b

Change-Id: Ia093d6e68d033d060afff863c22ef2d97490b0ff

commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Python objects returned with Yaml.load() may be dangerous if you receive
a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the Internet.
The function yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python
objects like integers or lists.

In ordered_load we're adding a custom class so we have to use yaml.load.
In order to make it safe, set the base class to SafeLoader instead of
Loader.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
Change-Id: I3d5df9898c72c59ddab0ac7562b953e91f470220

subject: Remove domain part from fqdn_<network> name.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-15 21:47:48.000000000', 'files': ['lib/facter/alt_fqdns.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/22a385d60982c435bf84ad1514372636cc787efe', 'message': 'Remove domain part from fqdn_<network> name.

If an user set CloudDomain after initial deployment then the
/etc/hosts will be filled with the new domain while the node will
still have the domain set by whatever was in dhcp_domain on the
undercloud.

This poses problem in all places where ::fqdn_$NETWORK is use in THT.
Removing the domain part here solves as we don't depends on the domain
anymore.

It may be argued that it's not the "fqdn" anymore, so maybe more work
is necessary and create a alt_dns.rb fact with proper adjustment of
the THT.

Change-Id: Ic9d8a791d19eb5db7438793446113d93cc176d4b
Related-Bug: #1581472
'}]
commit_message:
Remove domain part from fqdn_<network> name.

If an user set CloudDomain after initial deployment then the
/etc/hosts will be filled with the new domain while the node will
still have the domain set by whatever was in dhcp_domain on the
undercloud.

This poses problem in all places where ::fqdn_$NETWORK is use in THT.
Removing the domain part here solves as we don't depends on the domain
anymore.

It may be argued that it's not the "fqdn" anymore, so maybe more work
is necessary and create a alt_dns.rb fact with proper adjustment of
the THT.

Change-Id: Ic9d8a791d19eb5db7438793446113d93cc176d4b
Related-Bug: #1581472
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/60/464760/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Server support for display snapshot of zun stats

This patch adds support for display snapshot of zun stats at
server side.

Implements: blueprint support-stats-snapshot

Change-Id: Id82a4f9f7b9e32d202852083da5714e42751fe98

commit_message:
Improve keystone_authtoken configuration

Use built-in devstack function for that.

commit_message:
Isolate ansible-runtime venv site packages

In the isolated ansible-runtime venv, we were inheriting the system
site packages inside the virtualenv. This breaks the openstack-ansible
wrapper because it always assumes that ansible is installed in the
ansible-runtime venv. When ansible is already installed on the system,
pip does not reinstall it in the venv because it is inherited from
the system, so the wrapper fails.

This fix also includes a PATH entry in the openstack-ansible wrapper
which will make the wrapper more resilient against bugs like this
in the future.

Change-Id: Ifa5234cf7353f1443c5b77787363d8880b5cf0b6
Closes-Bug: #1690447
(cherry picked from commit 3bec543022099d38c702a9a047ef80a69b3b61e9)

commit_message:
Isolate ansible-runtime venv site packages

In the isolated ansible-runtime venv, we were inheriting the system
site packages inside the virtualenv. This breaks the openstack-ansible
wrapper because it always assumes that ansible is installed in the
ansible-runtime venv. When ansible is already installed on the system,
pip does not reinstall it in the venv because it is inherited from
the system, so the wrapper fails.

This fix also includes a PATH entry in the openstack-ansible wrapper
which will make the wrapper more resilient against bugs like this
in the future.

Change-Id: Ifa5234cf7353f1443c5b77787363d8880b5cf0b6
Closes-Bug: #1690447
(cherry picked from commit 3bec543022099d38c702a9a047ef80a69b3b61e9)

commit_message:
Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

Change-Id: I290fd1e5763bc89028bb9207dbd0bba33bacaa06

commit_message:
Enable custom keystone endpoint_type in templates

Allow to specify a custom AUTH_URL for the templates in case instances
cannot reach internalURL which is the case in mose deployment.

A new variable in trust section: trustee_keystone_interface which
default to public for OSA.

Also set magnum_client URL which is passed to instances to publicURL
also, this is similar to what is done with heat which default to
publicURL.

Related to this change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/455353/

Change-Id: I51bf7615ca91f90b7d998e66327ed1bb662783b6
Partial-Bug: #1643197
(cherry picked from commit 4b6f0444d64becedd990c67f82f961086be36390)

Because reno includes a setuptools plugin that runs during the egg_info
phase of a project, if the plugin is discovered all of the dependencies
for reno need to be installed for pip to work without generating an
infinite recursion issue as it tries to resolve the dependencies for
reno, discovers the reno plugin, tries to resolve the dependencies for
reno to use the plugin, etc. This problem is triggered when the
reno.egg_info directory exists as tox is run, because {toxinidir} is on

commit_message:
hack tox.ini to make the tests work

Because reno includes a setuptools plugin that runs during the egg_info
phase of a project, if the plugin is discovered all of the dependencies
for reno need to be installed for pip to work without generating an
infinite recursion issue as it tries to resolve the dependencies for
reno, discovers the reno plugin, tries to resolve the dependencies for
reno to use the plugin, etc. This problem is triggered when the
reno.egg_info directory exists as tox is run, because {toxinidir} is on
the import path for the python in the tox-managed virtualenv.

These changes work around the issue by stopping tox from managing the
packages installed in each environment and instead installing them as
part of the commands run for the environment. The commands are not
exactly the same in all cases because we don't need all of the
dependencies installed in all cases.

Change-Id: I695f1c928f1c440004bb892a691076f4afeb25da
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
remove out of date heat references

This removes some remnant heat code and references now that heat is
running in a plugin. Before merging this patch the heat team should
verify they got everything they needed into their heat plugin, as
there were more parts left than I was expecting.

Change-Id: I477e3a6e75591aa8ff836c28f7ef56aa1b5f8727

subject: Use uri module for git sourced configs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-16 08:35:42.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/gnocchi_post_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'vars/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_gnocchi/commit/5932746fe1717ef2798b46c374c268945f34814e', 'message': 'Use uri module for git sourced configs

The current mechanism uses a lookup, causing the
fetch of the default templates to happen via curl
from the deployment node. This causes problems if
the deployment node does not have access to the
repo server web service, which may be the case in
high security environments.

This patch changes the mechanism to only use the
lookup module for the file content that is on the
deployment node, then falls back to using the uri
module to fetch the default content. This ensures
that the deployment node does not have to reach
into the environment for the content.

Change-Id: Ia067a7cd2bc4460462b55f4631eba6e8eb693b0f
(cherry picked from commit ff82da926b0c4ebcfc27c030de70b4392e962e5b)

commit_message:
Use uri module for git sourced configs

The current mechanism uses a lookup, causing the
fetch of the default templates to happen via curl
from the deployment node. This causes problems if
the deployment node does not have access to the
repo server web service, which may be the case in
high security environments.

This patch changes the mechanism to only use the
lookup module for the file content that is on the
deployment node, then falls back to using the uri
module to fetch the default content. This ensures
that the deployment node does not have to reach
into the environment for the content.

Change-Id: Ia067a7cd2bc4460462b55f4631eba6e8eb693b0f
(cherry picked from commit ff82da926b0c4ebcfc27c030de70b4392e962e5b)

subject: Provide facility for a complete file override
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-16 08:34:56.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/gnocchi_post_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/gnocchi-deploy-config-file-afba6c2a8edac025.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_gnocchi/commit/bf1ded9755bfbcef203e5fab3e24c65077035cfa', 'message': 'Provide facility for a complete file override

Instead of forcing the use of config_override, this patch
provides a facility where the deployer can place a file
in /etc/openstack_deploy on the deployment host. The file
will be interpreted through the template engine (allowing
jinja to be used in the file) and placed on the target host.

If the file is not found, the fallback will be the default
file in the git source.

The patch also ensures that the curl is silent and therefore
does not show the download progress bar on the deployment

Change-Id: Ieab7eab7f902741e62e1d2a49191010f8fd38442
(cherry picked from commit 8aa6fcd12197a8ce30cc26496f3240d20934ce43)

commit_message:
Provide facility for a complete file override

Instead of forcing the use of config_override, this patch
provides a facility where the deployer can place a file
in /etc/openstack_deploy on the deployment host. The file
will be interpreted through the template engine (allowing
jinja to be used in the file) and placed on the target host.

If the file is not found, the fallback will be the default
file in the git source.

The patch also ensures that the curl is silent and therefore
does not show the download progress bar on the deployment
host when it executes.

Change-Id: Ieab7eab7f902741e62e1d2a49191010f8fd38442
(cherry picked from commit 8aa6fcd12197a8ce30cc26496f3240d20934ce43)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_gnocchi refs/changes/74/464974/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - The ``os_gnocchi`` role now includes a facility where you can place your own default ``api-paste.ini`` or ``policy.json`` file in ``/etc/openstack_deploy/gnocchi`` (by default) and it will be deployed to the target host after being interpreted by the template engine.

commit_message:
[AMQP 1.0] Properly shut down test RPC server

Otherwise the test server will hang attempting to re-connect
indefinitely.

Change-Id: I338a2f9fff4dfe08184a6476a6c47746646f63b8

commit_message:
Use zuul-cloner for tests repo in OpenStack-CI

When executing the tests repo clone in OpenStack-CI,
use zuul-cloner instead of git to enable cross-repo
testing. This ensures that if a dependent patch from
the tests repo is noted using 'Depends-On: <change-id>'
in the commit message, that patch will be included.

Depends-On: Idce7abebf32f24c356a27e099fbca954d917402b
Depends-On: I5da7802d61d2ab6b03908138e3a3ed2db22e3d29
Change-Id: I007306c47f9cc526b163c2e659baa67769affd84

subject: Reduce init restart/kill times
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-26 11:04:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_watcher/commit/95bb06e173cf2711f5071b39e9e9926a27f4f569', 'message': 'Make init restart/kill times configurable

In order to facilitate safely shutting down services, allow the
systemd time between SIGTERM and SIGKILL to be adjusted by the
deployer. Also lower the default from 5 minutes to 2.

Also lower the restart time from 150 seconds to 5 to recover more
quickly.

Change-Id: I8b220ca95512dcaccce5524f51c044b16c09b1b4
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-26 12:20:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_watcher/commit/a24cc651d9fa5e91f33c74350af2d8596d3e2fcd', 'message': "Reduce init restart/kill times

The systemd unit 'TimeoutSec' value which controls the time
between sending a SIGTERM signal and a SIGKILL signal when
stopping or restarting the service has been reduced from 300
seconds to 120 seconds. This provides 2 minutes for long-lived
sessions to drain while preventing new ones from starting
before a restart or a stop.

The 'RestartSec' value which controls the time between the
service stop and start when restarting has been reduced from
150 seconds to 2 seconds to make the restart happen faster.

These values can be adjusted by using the *_init_config_overrides
variables which use the config_template task to change template
defaults.

Change-Id: I8b220ca95512dcaccce5524f51c044b16c09b1b4
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-26 13:07:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_watcher/commit/3f238a384cee65edc23e180929e663e388f21473', 'message': "Reduce init restart/kill times

before a restart or a stop.

The 'RestartSec' value which controls the time between the
service stop and start when restarting has been reduced from
150 seconds to 2 seconds to make the restart happen faster.

These values can be adjusted by using the *_init_config_overrides
variables which use the config_template task to change template
defaults.

Change-Id: I8b220ca95512dcaccce5524f51c044b16c09b1b4
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce init restart/kill times

The systemd unit 'TimeoutSec' value which controls the time
between sending a SIGTERM signal and a SIGKILL signal when
stopping or restarting the service has been reduced from 300
seconds to 120 seconds. This provides 2 minutes for long-lived
sessions to drain while preventing new ones from starting
before a restart or a stop.

The 'RestartSec' value which controls the time between the
service stop and start when restarting has been reduced from
150 seconds to 2 seconds to make the restart happen faster.

These values can be adjusted by using the *_init_config_overrides
variables which use the config_template task to change template
defaults.

Change-Id: I8b220ca95512dcaccce5524f51c044b16c09b1b4

commit_message:
Use verify_on_create when creating pacemaker remote resources

We currently create remote resources without waiting for their creation.
This leads to the following potential race (spotted by Marian Mkrcmari):
- On Step1 pacemaker bootstrap node creates the resource but the remote
  resource is not yet created
- Step1 completes and Step2 starts
- On Step2 the remote node sets a property (or calls pcs cib) but the
  remote is not yet set up so 'pcs cluster cib' will fail there with:

    (err): Could not evaluate: backup_cib: Running: /usr/sbin/pcs cluster
    cib /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20170506-15994-1swnk1i failed
    with code: 1 ->

Note that when verify_on_create is set to true we are not using the cib
dump/push mechanism. That is fine because we create the remotes on
step1 and the dump/push mechanism is only needed starting from step2
when multiple nodes set cluster properties at the same time.

Tested by Marian Mkrcmari successfully as well.

Closes-Bug: #1689028

Change-Id: I764526b3f3c06591d477cc92779d83a19802368e
Depends-On: I1db31dcc92b8695ab0522bba91df729b37f34e0f

Remove apostrophe in task name

The apostrophe in "we're" causes vim on some platforms to have
syntax highlighting issues. Let's remove it!
